page.title: 14The Rector's Working Week.
page.content: During the week he spends his day visiting, or being consulted by, people who need his help. He will visit people chronically ill or who are in hospital. The hospitals may be as far afield as Oxford or Amersham, though usually in High Wycombe or Henley. He always visits homes where there has been a death. He prepares couples for marriage, expecting to see them five times before the wedding. He holds confirmation classes, and visits the schools each week, giving lessons in the two Church Schools. He regularly consults with his ten Churchwardens, attends five Parochial Church Council meetings every two months, as well as Chapter meetings which means travelling to High Wycombe or beyond. He will spend two or three hours preparing a five minute sermon.
